title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4111.31 - Fraudulent transfer of horse
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4111.31 - Fraudulent transfer of horse

State Regulations
(a) The transfer of a horse by any person or persons under suspension, unless to a
bona fide owner for a valuable consideration accompanied by the transfer of all
control over such horse, shall be deemed fraudulent and an effort to circumvent
said suspension. All parties thereto shall be subject to the penalties of this

Subchapter. (b) Anyone transferring
any ownership interest in a horse after the commission's refusal to license
such person or suspending or revoking such person's license shall be prohibited
from thereafter regaining any ownership interest in said horse. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4111.31

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
